Reviews.Title: “Truly awful”
Reviews.Author: uhilborn
Reviews.Content: Broken tiles on the bathroom floor, the shower door, moldy on the metal, was off its hinges, dreadful sagging mattresses. The garden , shown on their web site, is not accessible. The kitchen help seemed overwhelmed and dejected. My son had an equally dismal room with a sagging mattress, perfunctorily cleaned, a very suspect carpet and a perpetually occupied shared bathroom. The proprietor, when asked to fix the shower door, made soothing noises, came to inspect, clucked over it, forced it back on its track, which lasted for a few minutes, and did nothing further. He made some risible concession on the price. I paid, but after I returned to finally pick up suitcases, there was suddenly another charge of 300 pounds -- he had "forgotten to charge for the final days." We had a bit of a row over it and split the difference in the end. The Garth is a disgrace and a blot on Bloomsbury's Gower Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location cheap, friendly & clean free wifi”
Reviews.Author: Julian888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cheap for such a great location in the heart of Bloomsbury: next to UCL, Birkbeck, School of Tropical Hygine and Medicine, SOAS and the British Museum; and an easy walk to Euston and Saint Pancras stations. The facilities are very basic but clean. Toilets are shared, but showers are in the rooms. Breakfast is help yourself cereal, coffee, orange juice, plus there's a full English - veggie version is the same but with no meat - toast is white only. However, if you came to London to spend time in your hotel you should've stayed home! There are a hundred super cafes, coffee shops and restaurants within a short walk (Planet Organic is great!) and the Sacred coffee stand at the end of Tortington Square is excellent. The staff here are friendly, the rooms clean, the showers have plenty of hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Great location cheap, friendly & clean”
Reviews.Author: Julian888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cheap for such a great location in the heart of Bloomsbury: next to UCL, Birkbeck, School of Tropical Hygine and Medicine, SOAS and the British Museum; and an easy walk to Euston and Saint Pancras stations. The facilities are very basic but clean. Toilets are shared, but showers are in the rooms. Breakfast is help yourself cereal, coffee, orange juice, plus there's a full English - veggie version is the same but with no meat - toast is white only. However, if you came to London to spend time in your hotel you should've stayed home! There are a hundred super cafes, coffee shops and restaurants within a short walk (Planet Organic is great!) and the Sacred coffee stand at the end of Tortington Square is excellent. The staff here are friendly, the rooms clean, the showers have plenty of hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in, never again...”
Reviews.Author: Teapot21
Reviews.Content: Awful nights sleep. Mattress like sleeping on a griddle! Constant water noise from tap sink in room so like Chinese water torture! Scuttling noises all night ? What from!! No loo in room and loo down the corridor was shared between 3 rooms. Every available space has a bed in it. Miserable!

Reviews.Title: “nowhere near as bad as the other reviews say”
Reviews.Author: Lou101284
Reviews.Content: this is a guest style hotel. brilliant location close too Euston station and underground, quite basic rooms but clean. stayed with a friend in a twin room, consisted of two single beds, sink, kettle, TV, hair dryer, chest of drawers, wardrobe and fan, shared toilet and shower facilities on the landing. tasty breakfast consisted of full English, toast and cereal, with orange juice and coffee. very good value for money. would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Aiasally
Reviews.Content: The room was tidy.It was like it was one room cut in two. Would of liked a double bed.Instead we got two single beds lined up on each other.And that was the size of the room. This must of been done to grab as much money as poss. The light shade was dirty. No en suite.Which i knew about.But there wasn't even a bath in the shared bathroom. The breakfast was very good.Full english cerael toast. That was the only good thing. Close to tube. We paid 75 pounds. Wouldn't stop again.

Reviews.Title: “Zero points, This is a dirty grimey "hotel"”
Reviews.Author: cosyme
Reviews.Content: I stay at this "hotel" the night before a family funeral, our room and the whole building appeared to be furnished by items from a car boot sale. The room was dirty and the furniture was badly stained. Do not be taken in by the room charge, or the outside facade, we paid over Â£120 for the nght. I had to fill the kettle with a cup, because it was too big to fit in the sink or under the tap, and pour boiling water on the shower tray before using it. Breakfast was so poor that we left the "hotel" early, than spend any more time in our room. Breakfast consist of 1 egg, 1 slice of bacon, 1 mini sausage, 1 mushroom and half a tomatoe! When I got home I notice bite marks on my arm and devloped a rash on my face. I would at best describe this place as a old style DHSS lodging. We were also asked to pay upfront before we saw the room. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS ACCOMODATION TO ANY ONE. There is a travelokdge a few minutes away stay there it's a lot cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as some of the other reviews say!”
Reviews.Author: Paraprin
Reviews.Content: This is a guest house style hotel with a quirky independent feel. If you are looking for a plush upmarket get away then this is probably not for you. The decor of the hotel may be considered dated by some but we felt it added charm and home-like quality to our stay. Breakfast was very good and we were pleased. We slept well during our stay. This hotel was no better/worse than any other I have stayed in in London for it's price range. I will definitely be staying again and would recommend for a reasonably cheap and cheerful stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: anniet69
Reviews.Content: Room dated. Tv from 1990 didn't work. Shower door dangerously out of repair. "en suite" was a trap. My husband nearly broke the door down trying to get out. Breakfast was a shambles, no organisation & very mean on portions. Icing on the cake? They had workmen ripping up the carpets in the rooms around us at 8am on a Sunday morning, with no warning. Bloody dismal.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved”
Reviews.Author: NinkyNonk
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before for business visits to London. The hotel wasn't the best, but then the price was cheap, location very central and breakfast was good and filling. This last visit I found that they had re-decorated the rooms and re-carpeted the whole hotel, so I thought I'd give them a review to encourage the positive changes going on. If you've stayed here before you'll find it much nicer now. The staff have always been OK with me and helpful with directions and leaving baggage and their Wi-Fi seems to have improved as I picked it up on the second floor OK.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a growl”
Reviews.Author: lilawheel
Reviews.Content: If you like surliness served with indifference, the Garth is the hotel for you. I stayed there years ago before it changed hands and was in for an unpleasant surprise. The new ownership has let the hotel run down to a very seedy state. But the worse aspect is the appalling management who could care less about the comfort or well-being of itheir guests. Their main concern seems to be the Chinese soap operas they are constantly glued to on the office computer downstairs.. They rarely looked up and were quite annoyed by querries about the internet which they advised us to pirate from the neighboring hotel. Breakfast was terrible and our room was not made up since we stayed in it till 9:30!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Burrows6
Reviews.Content: Clever marketing means that you think room with shower means that the en suite does not have a bath. It really means there is no en suite only a crappy shower in corner of room. Toilet is down a staircase outside the room! Breakfast stops at 9 on Saturday.... I'm having a mini break, surly 9.30 would be better?? Dirty, noisy smelly place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: beddoej
Reviews.Content: My client was absolutely disgusted with your hotel. His complaints were that he was put in a basement room next to a generator (did not sleep for 2 nights). The windows would not shut so his belonging could have been robbed and he could hear every foot step and conversation from out side and the room was very cold at night. There was barely enough room to move around the bed and the toilet was situated right next to a member of staff having their break (eating food). The entrance door was locked at 11pm so if you wanted to go and see the sights you could not as you would have been locked out as the reception was not manned at that time of night.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: chickenlips642
Reviews.Content: Arrived and was asked for payment immediately with a discount of Â£5.00 if payed by cash. The room was dirty and had NO EN SUITE FACILITIES. The breakfast ,to be fair, was good and the location was excellant,

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Senttu
Reviews.Content: I got reserved of all the negative reviews, but cannot understand what kind of luxury people expect from small hotels like The Garth. I stayed two nights with my daughter and we had a nice and clean room on the first floor. I warmly recommend ear plugs if you're light sleeper. The only thing I should have find out beforehand was the shared toilet. We walked a lot and with tired feet it sometimes was hard to walk the stairs. Breakfast was good, possibility to have good English breakfast. When we asked more heat to our room the polite staff switched heat on and closed our window properly. So, we don't have any complainments of service either.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE PLEASE DONT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Gillian1845
Reviews.Content: Absolutely scruffy, staff were very unhelpful and to top it all we hadnt been there one whole day when the room was broken into and my daughters i-pod touch was stolen. The manager was not interested at all. Avoid this hoyel at all costs. Wish id read the reviews first

Reviews.Title: “Scruffy and Over-priced!”
Reviews.Author: MiriamWakefield
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Garth on two occasions. The first impression was it was very 'basic' but clean - staff seemed pleasant and friendly, the breakfast was adequate, but a bit lacking for vegetarians. Unfortunately, on our second stay we found the room cramped and stuffy with hardly any ventilation from the sash window (appeared jammed), furniture really shabby with shelves hanging off the walls, stained carpets and sink and shower stall both looking really grubby. We found the nearest toilet was two floors up with protruding floor tiles that were badly fitted and had sharp edges. In spite of friendly staff, admittedly pretty clean bedlinen and towels etc, this hotel is greatly over-priced even for a central London location. A friend who travelled with us stayed at a hotel a couple of doors down and had a much better standard of accommodation for a sensible price. In short: we can't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel i have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: GARY087
Reviews.Content: i wish i had read reviews before booking in.My wife and i stayed one night in room 18 on the ground floor. The room was dirty with a black layer of dirt all round the skirting boards. The carpet was stained and holed,the radiator was thick with dust the wardrobe had fallen away from the wall and the only shelf in the room was hanging off. The television had no arial the tap constantly dripped, curtains were filthy and not attached properly. i found a pack of condoms on top of the wardrobe. We lay awake all night for fear off what might come out the woodwork. DO NOT TOUCH THIS EXCUSE FOR A HOTEL WITH A BARGE POLE

Reviews.Title: “1 Night Only Please”
Reviews.Author: Jenii_28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for 1 night for convinence and would'nt want to stay again. This hotel is right on the main road a makes sleeping very uncomfortable and near impossible. The walls are paper thin and people can be heard talking in the room next door. Breakfast was average but enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “its the garth for me”
Reviews.Author: slinn2006
Reviews.Content: hi travellers just letting you all know its not as bad as the reviews to be frank very comfy bed excelent breakfast super location lovely polite staff and for the bucks great value the garth is one cool dude very authentic see you all have fun

Reviews.Title: “Viva le Garth”
Reviews.Author: steve3102
Reviews.Content: Excellent value,prime location,clean bed linen and towels,decent breakfast. What do some people expect for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptively, unbelievably, bad. RIP OFF.”
Reviews.Author: BlackRose80
Reviews.Content: Apparently a Grade 2 listed building on an apparently attractive street close to the centre of London. There ends the positives about this place. Peeling ceiling paper with mould, holes in carpets, the stench of damp, broken sinks and shower floors - fixed with duct tape!, unvacuumed, falling to bits in the most appalling sense. Got this place in utter desperation as Eurostar cancellation forced its customers to get emergency accommodation - it was the only affordable room left within 3 miles of St Pancras Station. At Â£89.00 for a double for one night, it is, by a chasm, the biggest rip off I've ever come across in my life. Picture frames that looked like they were about to collapse on us at any moment, dodgy window, cupboard that looked dirty, a chair that looked like it hadn't been cleaned since the 17th century....even the tapwater for brushing teeth tasted funny. The first thing you feel like doing when you leave is find the nearest decent hotel and wash the grime off you. A receptionist calling every 5 seconds, virtually on the brink of kicking down your door reminding you again and again that check-out time is close (clearly in cuckooland with the belief that anyone would actually want to stay there a second longer than is absolutely necessary).....beggars belief. You wouldn't wish this place on your worst enemy. STEER CLEAR.

Reviews.Title: “Better to choose a cardboard box on a street corner than this disgusting excuse for a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 321rct
Reviews.Content: I would not even recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. It is without doubt the worst hovel I have had the misfortune to stay in. It was booked in a hurry, with no real checking beforehand. While the location is great - very convenient for Soho, Oxford street and the West End - this does not compensate for the dirt, neglect and disinterest of the staff. I felt ashamed to be British if this is what we offer tourists. I cannot stress highly enough how you must, must, choose another hotel rather than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think of it!”
Reviews.Author: nickwlondon
Reviews.Content: The 69 Gower Street, Bloomsbury. London WC1E - was a nightmare of a stay. It's not just run down, it is falling apart. Drunks roam the narrow blighted corridors and the doors slam shut echoing through the thin walls. Electrical fitting loosely wired lay on the floor. Bathroom disgusting and I had to buy a bottle of Dettol to add some form of protection. Staff were courteous but what was that sticking out of the rear of the track-suit of the female assistant manager called early one morning to close my account? I really did not want to know more..I just got out as quickly as my two legs could carry me!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Arnold2683
Reviews.Content: We went there as a group of four and had two rooms booked. From the outside along side the other hotels, it looked pretty nice - but beyond the front door is where the real nightmare begins! The reception is hidden away down stairs, and we weren't greeted on arrival. The lady spent more time looking at her computer than talking to us. We were then given our keys, and as two groups i was hoping they'd locate us near each other, but we ended up on different floors. When we got to our room, our family size was no larger than a standard double you would get in any other hotel. When i lied down on the bed, it was broken and i was flung off the other side (To the amusement of my brother), still, comical beds wasn't something i paid for. The toilet floor was cracked with loose tiles. The shower also had a cracked bottom with sharp edges, very dangerous. In my friends 'double' room, it turned out to be two single beds pushed head to toe, with a shower unit in the corner of the room. They had to use communal toilets which were up a flight of stairs. Â£220 was the total cost for us four, and i think we all feel very ripped off. Glad I didn't eat the breakfast after reading comments about mice! Just wish i'd been on this site and read the reviews before i stayed there. The only good thing was it's location, was about a 2 minute walk from Goodge Street tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GerryMotherwell
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel it is dirty and expenisve and the staff are unhelpful. Breakfast is awful and I was asked to sit at a dirty table.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandksUk
Reviews.Content: I made a request for my daughter to have a late checkout as she was arriving very late. They said yes over the phone and then throw her out in the morning. The staff denied all knowledge of the conversation and they where rude and very impolite. I wouldn't stay here if this was the last hotel left in London.

Reviews.Title: “A dirty and unkempt hotel”
Reviews.Author: dishmop
Reviews.Content: There were a number of good things about our stay. My son and I were accommodated in a quiet room, at my request; the bed linen and towels were clean; the toilet, basin and shower were also clean. Also, the faulty smoke alarm was mended within seconds of my pointing out that it was not working. Reception staff were polite and helpful. However, the room itself was in an appalling state. The carpet is old and stained. The wallpaper is stained and peeling from the walls. The curtains do not fit the window and only hung in sections from a piece of wire. The window frames are filthy. There is thick layer of dirt along the top of the picture rail which goes round the room. There is a cigarette burn hole in one of the bedspreads and cigarette burn marks on the bedside table. The corners of bathroom floor and base of the walls and lower parts of the pipes are stained and filthy. In every corner there were deposits and occasional hairs. The mousetrap behind the toilet didn't inspire confidence. There is no plug in the basin and the lid of the toilet cistern appeared broken. The standard of accommodation is more that of cheap student lodgings than a London hotel that offers its services with any pride. When I mentioned the state of the room to the reception staff she claimed that the age of the building explained the dirt. This is an untenable argument. Breakfast service was extremely poor. I asked for tea. None came for about fifteen minutes. When I went to ask again, the staff appeared to have forgotten it. I was brought a teapot. No cup, saucer, spoon or milk. I asked for a cup. A member brought a large pile of cups into the dining room but did not give one to me. As I went to help myself to one she set about wiping the surface of the servery, which involved moving the milk out of my reach each time I tried to take hold of the jug. There were no teaspoons. I did mention the state of the room to the reception staff. She asked what I wanted her to do about it. I suggested that the room be cleaned properly for future guests. She asked if I was expecting a refund and pointed out that the Â£89 cost of the room was already cheap. I said I would accept a refund if she felt it was appropriate. She tried to ring the manager, but failed to get through. She then took Â£5 from the bill.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING read other comments and Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: FedupandtiredUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be condemed, it is not fit for anyone. Dangerous Electrical Sockets hanging off walls, live mice in room, mould in shower, dirty toilet, dirty paintwork. In the coldest month for years you had on the bed one sheet and a blanket, there was a duvet in cupboard but without a cover on. This place was filthy and does not even warrant a rating, it should be shut down. Would not even recommend it to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Mice in the room and other things”
Reviews.Author: eri_lar
Reviews.Content: I am writing this as I am sitting on the bed of room no. 11 of Garth hotel on Saturday Dec 5 2009, and would gladly have left already if it hadn't been the last available room in this part of London. Here is just a selection of things wrong at this place: - the room obviously hadn't been cleaned (empty bottle under the bed, used toilet paper in some corner of the bath room, cobwebs all over etc.) - there is no toilet paper - the only chair in the room (which accomodates 4 people) has a broken back - there is only one night stand and only one bedside lamp - there is no table, no place to hang a towel or put a toilet bag - And last, but not least, there are mice running around the room. When my partner went to the receptionist to inform her of all this, she was just as unfriendly as she had been all along. Incidentally, the only thing she seemed to doubt was the mice. Anyway, even though breakfast tomorrow morning is included in the price (a steep 130 pounds for the room, by the way), neither my partner nor I will have a bite to eat in this place. If there are mice on the third floor, I don't even want to know what the kitchen looks like. By the way, I have just been back on their website to write a complaint, and was interested to see that their visitor's comments section was empty...

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: WijBrussels
Reviews.Content: Beleive what you read in the most reviews, we didn't and regretted it. Our two rooms probably were once one room. They just putted a wooden wall in the middle. We actually could talk with our son on the other side. Twin beds were not put side by side, but head by foot. Take your prozac with you if you want to survive.

Reviews.Title: “worst ever!”
Reviews.Author: tarbo
Reviews.Content: Coming from the states for the last three years we had a wonderful run of hotels, until the Garth. We figured, Gower Street, must be good. Wrong. First the manager wouldn't even come out of the basement, it was dingy, dirty, mildew and cracked tiles in the bathroom, paint peeling from the ceiling. We complained about the dirty floor and he blamed it on a new maid. We asked for ice and were told they didn't have any, ever. At breakfast, no yogurt, no fruit, no wheat toast. A sad depressing place. I would not have been so bad if they weren't charging premium prices! I would not send my worst enemy to this place. Avoid it like the plague, in fact you might actually get the plague if you go here.

HotelInfo.Name: Garth Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 69 Gower Street, London WC1E 6HJ, England
